result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaden M Spatz

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  9:15 a.m. 
INCLUDES 21CF1584, 22CF303, 22CF504, 22CF552.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Heather Roehr. 

Date and time set for JPTC; parties have reached a plea.  

22CF303>>Waiver of Preliminay Hearing.  
Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

21CF1584>>
State moves to DRI Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT GRANTS.

22CF303>>
State moves to DRI Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT GRANTS.

22CF504>>
State moves to DRI Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony) and Count 2 (Operating While Revoked/Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal); COURT GRANTS.

22CF552>>
State moves to DRI Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony), Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Felony), Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Felony), Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Felony) and Count 5 (Operating While Revoked/Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal); COURT GRANTS.

PLEA: 
21CF1584 Count 2  (Operating While Revoked/Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal): NO CONTEST. 

22CF303 Count 2  (Operating While Revoked/Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal): NO CONTEST.  

COURT ORDERS on each count:  $50.00 fine plus court costs including DNA sample/surcharge. 

Adj:  9:26 a.m.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. No possession of drug paraphernalia.   Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.   Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (2) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:28 pm.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Deft appears from MCJ, Attorney Mathie is making a special appearance. 
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

Prelim Time Limits Waived. 

COURT ORDERS: $5,000 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of controlled substances, except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 
- No possession of drug paraphernalia.
- No driving without a valid license. 
- Prints and photograph. 

- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

>>FUTURE DATES: 
JPTC: 5/17 at 9:10 am. 

Adj: 2:34 pm.
